newsitem.title: USA: Palm Beach Cty, Fla., bed tax hike advances.
newsitem.headline: Palm Beach Cty, Fla., bed tax hike advances.

text.p: Florida's House Finance and Taxation Committee has approved a proposal allowing Palm Beach County to raise its hotel bed tax to finance a $48 million convention center.
The bill (CS/HB179) by Rep. Ed Healey, D-West Palm Beach, would allow the county commission to increase the tax to five percent from four percent.
It was approved on Friday. A companion bill in the Senate (SB 2252) passed the Senate Community Affairs Committee earlier in the week.
Palm Beach County and City of West Palm Beach officials are still debating financing proposals for the center, which would be build on 25 acres across from the Kravis Center for the Performing Arts.
